CatDescriptText: Cutline of related image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, February 7, 1953, pg. 1, reads: "Like This Hobby? - How would you like to have a hobby that would earn you more income than your present job affords if you were to retire and make that hobby your vocation? Well, that's just what one well-known Pittsburgher has going for him... The talented Clifford Morrison, of 850 Delmont Avenue, Beltzhoover, who is possessed with a great amount of creative ability...  Household Exhibits - Mrs. Helen Morrison, wife, who encourages her husband in his hobby, shows a few of the household exhibits which he made for her to be used in their home at 850 Delmont Avenue, Beltzhoover.  On display are a miniature, old style fire engine, a waiter, a jewel box, a vanity chest and an inebriate leaning against a lamp post - all made from scraps of metal, wood, pipe, wire, linoleum and talcum powder can tops.  Also shown is a set of early American salt and pepper shakers made from brass ingots and discarded billiard balls... - Harris Photos."
TitMainTitle: Helen Morrison standing over table with boxes, small sculptures, and salt and pepper shakers made by Clifford "Cliff" Morrison, 850 Delmont Avenue, Beltzhoover
